elements.content: How to get Safari’s privacy features in Chrome.
By John Doe

resource.alt: Smart device and web data cloud savings and analysis

elements.content: Keeping your web browser private is more important than ever these days. Here’s how to get Safari’s privacy features on Chrome.
01/04
Check your passwords
Run an audit on your existing passwords in Chrome.

resource.alt: Screenshot of chrome browser settings with a pointer on Passwords menu

elements.content: Go to Chrome Settings and click Passwords.
02/04
Install Noblockers.
To get even more tracking data about a URL, or to block it, Safari-style, use an extension like Noblockers.

resource.alt: Screenshot of a browser extension with information on blocked URLs
Businessman standing on magnifying glass analyzing data

elements.content: Almost there! You are more than halfway through.
03/04
Police Extensions
To police extension permissions, go to Choose More Tools > Extensions from the Chrome menu.

resource.alt: More tools menu in Chrome browser

elements.content: 04/04
Detailed Extensions
Then click Details next to the extension you need.

resource.alt: Browser extension details modal with buttons to see more details and to remove the extension
